result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph A Villalpando was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Pay mandatory domestic abuse surcharge. All other costs are waived.

Defendant Joseph A Villalpando in court with attorney Donald L. Conner.  Defendant Joseph A Villalpando in custody.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
St- In 15CF128 Plea to count 2, count 3 & count 6; DRI the balance. In 15CF796 Plea to count 5, count 6 & count 9; DRI the balance.
Rights Given
P- NC 
BTC: Finding of guilt on count 2, count 3 & count 6; DRI the balance in 15CF128. Finding of guilt on count 5, count 6 & count 9; DRI the balance in 15CF796. 

15CF128
Count 2- 9 Months RCJ 

Count 3- 9 Months RCJ, to run concurrent to count 2

Count 6- 9 Months RCJ, to run concurrent to count 2 & count 3

15CF796
Count 5- 5 Years WPS, 2 Years init, 3 Years es

Count 6- 5 Years WPS, 2 Years init, 3 Years es, to run concurrent to count 5

Count 9- 5 Years WPS, 2 Years init, 3 Years es, to run concurrent with count 5 & count 6 but consecutive to 15CF128

Conditions: 
No contact with E.V.
Comply with family court order
Comply with mental health program 
Supervised visits with child - unless modified by agent
Provide a DNA Sample + pay surcharge in 15CF796 on count 5 only & 15CF128 on count 2 only 
Pay a domestic violence surcharge of $100 on count 2 in 15CF128
Court costs are waived in 15CF128 & 15CF796
FAW
VOTE
Eligible for ERP & CIP
